message.content:
cs.HC, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CV. 

The paper discusses the development of a greedy algorithm for interpreting user referring expressions in multimodal conversational interfaces. This involves incorporating cognitive principles such as Conversational Implicature and Givenness Hierarchy, as well as applying constraints from various sources. This work is highly relevant to the field of Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC), as well as Natural Language Processing (cs.CL), Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI), Machine Learning (cs.LG), and Computer Vision (cs.CV) due to the use of multiple modalities in the interface.
